comment.author: 13070533@N07
comment._content:
The upper picture is interesting, although obviously posed, since they appear to be using captured Russian Moisin-Nagant rifles. This suggests second-line troops, but the standard field caps seem to rule out Landsturm which leaves either Landwehr or a reserve formation.

I admit to the caption to the lower picture raising a smile - I doubt very much whether these men could haul that gun into position as it's set in a concrete emplacement! The Germans seem to be either infantrymen who have been pressed into service to help their Austrian comrades-in-arms or Bavarian artillerymen, since the only man wearing a pickelhaube has a spike rather than the artillery's ball (only Bavarian artillery wore spikes on their pickelhauben).
